title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Hi all, Im new to the forum and trying to learn to repair macbooks.. :)
I got this macbook air with the trackpad click not working, the fuse was blown (its never the fuse) I tested the line and seems ok, replaced the fuse and it worked again... all good BUT when I tried to remove the board again I pressed the reset switch next to the battery connector WITH the USB-C power still connected to the board.... I pressed and kept pressed for some seconds twice because the fan started to spin... then I realized why.... After that the machine wont boot, It gets 20V and start booting it goes briefly until 0.5A the returns to 0.45A and stays there, after some seconds it restarts the boot process again, I dont get anything on the screen. the CPU start to get warm and fan starts spining...
The switch SW6955 still gets 3.3V
All the SLPS2R are with te correct voltage.
PVDDCPUAWAKE_SW0 to SW3 when booting 0.97V then goes to 0.55V and stays there

PP1v2_S0SW: 1.19V

PP1v_S0SW: 1V

PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: 0.95V

PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: 1.1V

PPVCORE_S0_CPU: 0.84V

PPVCCGT_S0_CPU: 0V

ALL_SYSPWRGD: 1.8V

Trackpad click still works, no green light on keyboard, if I connect an usb to the usbc it  gets  light for a second

Thank you in advance

[MEDIA=youtube]WXGKFKMpVz0[/MEDIA]

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

L7210/30 voltage starts with 0.84V and remains stable?
Caps Lock light reacts pressing the key?
Did you try DFU?

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Thank you for your reply,
L7210: yes stable (in both pins)
L7230: yes stable (in both pins)
No Caps Lock green light
It wont go to DFU by itself or by pressing the keys combination (DFU never appears on configurator 2). It will reboot after few seconds anyways as you can see on the video.
Screen always black.

L7230: 6.5 Ohms
L7210: 6.5 Ohms
L7430: 5 Ohms
L7410: 5 Ohms
L8102: 52.4 Ohms

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
This machine should be detected in DFU.
Did you exactly follow all the steps in DFU tutorial?
Be sure to use the correct USB-C port.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Ok after many attempts i managed to go to DFU. I comes with a lock and tellsm it has to update the system. The problem with this is that I dont want to update the BridgeOS ;)
is there a way? like flashing the T2 ROM or other chip?

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: No, DFU automatically updates it...

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: so lets say DFU didnt help, what else can I try

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
"I comes with a lock and tellsm it has to update the system."
What kind of lock?
You should get padlock icon once DFU ends.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
yes thats what i mean a padlock icon, I tried and the same not boot... could be  dead CPU? it gets warm then power cycles...
*now i get the sound when i connect the usb-c power before I didnt get that sound...
Battery charges

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Check for USB activity and external video.

BTW, if you get padlock icon, that means DFU was completed and BridgeOS is now upgraded.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:

Tried but no external video - *It was in recovery mode need to install OS so I dont think I can see external video in that stage.
If I connect a usb stick or a mouse its light flashes briefly but not like reading activity

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: I don't know what else can do, apart of real DFU (not Recovery).

message:

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Drops from 1V to 0.84V?
In fact should drop to 0.6V when booting (after few seconds).

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: it goes streight from 0v to 0.844 when USB-C starts pulling 0.4x Amps then stays in 0.844-0.845 until power cycle then starts over. Something makes it reboot...

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Try to complete DFU restore, if possible.
If you still worrying about BridgeOS update, no idea...

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
Do you know which are the equivalent to the lines: LPC_FRAME_L, LPC_CLK24M_SMC in these T2 machines?
I want to try the troubleshooting method that checks the wave form on those lines, I want to check if it is the CPU

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
LPC bus is not used anymore now.
The corresponding PCH lines are now used as SPI bus, between T2 and PCH.

CPU core voltage is dinamically adjusted.
PCH, CPU and BIOS (T2) are involved there.
And BIOS can only be (automatically) reflashed in DFU.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 92636, member: 682"]
LPC bus is not used anymore now.
The corresponding PCH lines are now used as SPI bus, between T2 and PCH.

CPU core voltage is dinamically adjusted.
PCH, CPU and BIOS (T2) are involved there.
And BIOS can only be (automatically) reflashed in DFU
[/QUOTE]

Hmmmm sounds really easy....

One more thing, I noticed that  L7030 is 1.9Mohm / 0.455 on diode mode, isnt that kind of low?

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message:
L7030 is not in the same position as old boards.
Don't use it as refference, unless you find short to ground there.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: tried to do DFU many times, the step 4 takes a longtime after that it goes to the lockpad icon with a warning at the botton saying the system has not booted or something like that and the system needs to be repaired if I try to repair it fails saying that in this state it cannot be repaired so I do DFU again and happens the same...

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: Reflash U4770 and try DFU again.

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: Desoldering the chip I lost the 20ohm resistor on the left side R4773 (SPI_SOCROM_MISO Line), I dont have a 20ohm resistor I got a 22ohm same specs, can I use it?

title: Macbook Air A1932 820-01521-A No boot, 20V it goes to 0.45A then power cycling
message: Yeah, sure.
